properties.description: Posted by LcallananBethel, AK

properties.name: All Saints High School
properties.description: Posted by Lcallanan In my novel, students attend a Catholic high school that\'s located directly on the beach in Southern California. I got the idea for the location from this elementary school, which, if you click to "satellite" or "hybrid" view,you can see has its blacktop and field located right in the middle of the sandy beach.

properties.name: American Merchant Marine Memorial
properties.description: Posted by LcallananThe protagonist of the novel, All Saints, visits this memorial at the beginning of the second part of the book. Some folks in line for the Statue of Liberty ferry shot some video of of the memorial in daytime.

properties.name: Anchorage, Alaska
properties.description: Posted by LcallananAnchorage, Alaska

properties.name: Emily takes a spin on the Ferris wheel
properties.description: Posted by LcallananIn the second part of the novel, Emily, takes the ferry over from her home on Balboa Island to a small amusement park (which, in the novel, is called the "Play Zone") and rides the Ferris wheel. I found the video below on YouTube -- it gives a good sense, albeit with a wink, of how scary the Ferris wheel can be.

properties.name: Kodiak Island
properties.description: Posted by Lcallanankodiak, alaska

properties.name: The Golden Eagle Saloon
properties.description: Posted by LcallananSo I happened to be in Fairbanks, Alaska for a reading for my first book, The Cloud Atlas. And afterwards, when my hosts asked if I\'d like to grab a drink at a grill-your-own-meat place frequented by gold prospectors...I of course said yes. We sat and talked. One of my hosts taught at the local Catholic high school. And just hearing her talk about her days there got me to thinking. Mind you, nothing like what happens in ALL SAINTS ever happened to her. It wasn\'t so much her stories as her place, in this school, this outpost in a kind of wilderness, that stayed with me. Doesn\'t make sense that I was inspired to write a book set in Orange County, California after spending a night swapping stories in Ester? Then I\'m not telling it right.

properties.name: The Other Panera
properties.description: Posted by Lcallanan5575 N Port Washington Rd, Glendale, WII wrote a lot of this novel before I moved to Milwaukee, at that other Panera I\'ve mentioned. When I got here, like a good superstitious writer, I figured I should go to another branch of the same chain to finish it. So I did. Surrounded by freeways and strip mall shopping, it\'s not the most lyric place to write. But it is where I got it finished.

properties.name: The Writers' Panera
properties.description: Posted by Lcallanan3201 Duke St, Alexandria, 22314Here\'s the Panera where I finished writing my first novel, THE CLOUD ATLAS, and started my second, ALL SAINTS. Why do I like writing in coffee shops? I used to say I didn\'t know, but now I do: I like the coffee. There are plenty of treats to reward yourself with for doing the work. You -- or, really, I -- don\'t play games (solitaire, etc.) because I feel like the others who are watching-not-watching me would look down on me for doing so. And, most important -- or, as important as the endless free refills of coffee -- I\'m always so afraid that someone will steal my laptop that I do not get out of my chair. And that, it turns out, is the secret to writing.

properties.name: This is where *I* went to school
properties.description: Posted by Lcallanan 1901 Venice Blvd, Los Angeles, CAMy novel takes place in a small Catholic high school in Southern California, so people want to know: is it about YOUR high school? It\'s not. The high school in my novel is located on the beach, my high school was located just west of downtown LA across from a cemetery, whose crematorium we could smell certain mornings. Oh, and the high school in my book is co-ed. Mine was definitely all-male. (If you\'re curious to know what it looks like -- my alma mater, not the novel\'s -- rent Donnie Darko, which was filmed there.)

properties.name: Where Emily lives on Balboa Island
properties.description: Posted by LcallananEmily, my protagonist, lives on Balboa Island, on Diamond Avenue.

properties.name: basement, Sewanee writers conference
properties.description: Posted by LcallananIn 2004, a few months after my first novel, The Cloud Atlas, came out, I found myself spending a few very warm days in Sewanee, TN at the Sewanee writers\' conference. The Sewanee campus is beautiful...and very strange. It\'s located on top of a broad, flat mountain -- out west, you\'d call it a mesa -- and makes expansive use of gothic architecture. Each afternoon, I went for a run. Each afternoon, I got completely lost in the thick forest. Each afternoon I met some incredibly strange locals. It got me to thinking.
